Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th July, 2021.

“(3A) An exempted person may organise, or 
cause to be organised, an event to be held in a dwelling 
(including that part of the dwelling that is outdoors) in a 
relevant geographical location for social or recreational

person’s place of residence, and

of

by the insertion of the following paragraph after paragraph (6): 

“(7) 

In this Regulation - 

“diagnosis of previous Covid-19 or SARSCoV-2 
infection” means, in relation to a person, a person who 
has in the previous 9 months - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

been the subject of a RT-PCR test, 

Covid-19 or the virus SARSCoV-2 was detected in the person 
at the time of taking the test, and 

not less than 11 days has passed 
following - 

(i) 

(ii) 

the detection, or 

the onset of symptoms, 

whichever is the later. 

“exempted person” means - 

(a) 

(b) 

a vaccinated person, or 

a person who has a diagnosis of 
previous Covid-19 or SARSCoV2 infection; 

“RT-PCR test” means a reverse transcription polymerase 
chain reaction test, the purpose of which is to detect the 
presence of Covid-19, or the virus SARS-CoV-2, in the 
person to whom it is administered; 

“symptom”, in relation to Covid-19 or the virus SARSCoV-2, means, subject to any regulations made under 
section 38G of the Act of 1947 -

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: 6. Regulation 8 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the
text_raw:
6. Regulation 8 of the Principal Regulations is amended by the 

substitution of the following paragraph for paragraph (1A): 

“(1A) A person may organise, or cause to be organised, a 

relevant event in a relevant geographical location where - 

(a) 

the person takes all reasonable steps to ensure 
that - 

(i) 

(ii) 

the event takes place entirely outdoors, 
and 

the number of persons attending, or 
proposed to attend, the event - 

(I) 

(II) 

does not exceed 500 where the 
event is held, or to be held, in a 
relevant venue, or 

does not exceed 200 where the 
event is held, or to be held, other 
than in a relevant venue, 

or 

(b) 

the event is a scheduled event.”

title: and other Emergency Measures in the Public Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary 
Restrictions) (Covid-19) (No. 2) Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 217 of 2021) to 
make amendments to the list of “Scheduled Events”, and to provide for 
increases in the numbers permitted to attend wedding receptions and at outdoor 
relevant events. These Regulations also provide that there shall be no limit on 
the numbers of people who may visit together once they are all fully protected 
by vaccination or have had COVID-19 infection in the previous nine months. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [329] 11
